pageContext.description: A Rivet in each piece. Traces of light earth all over.
pageContext.patina: Pale greyish green, with small patches of green.
pageContext.surface: Smooth - side of Rim is slightly pitted.
pageContext.other: Length; A: 68mm; B: 78mm,Width: A: 33mm; B: 32mm,Thickness: from 1.5mm to 5mm,Weight: A: 70.88 gms; B: 81.5 gms; Total: 152.38 gms
pageContext.associations: One of a Bronze Founder's Hoard of 16 Socketed Celts, 20 Lumps of Rough Metal, 14 Pieces of socketed celts, 14 small pieces of an earthenware pot, 4 pieces of tim of burial urn, a pair of burial urn handles, 3 spearheads, 1 chape and part of a socketed tool.
pageContext.publications: Trans. Essex. Arch. Soc. N.S. VI, 172.
pageContext.collection: Colchester Museum,(151.94),Presented to Essex Arch. Soc. by Lord Rookwood, 1894,(Trans. Essex Arch. Soc N.S., VI, 172)
pageContext.toSearch: Hatfield Broad Oak, Bishop's Stortford, Essex Cm22, UK
